paper_metadata.title: Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP) impact evaluation on agricultural outcomes

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP) is Ethiopia's poverty reduction strategy that forms the most important pillar of the country's agricultural transformation

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We find no evidence that PSNP participation improved technology adoption, time spent in agriculture, household-level access to agricultural services, or women's control over agricultural assets. However, PSNP participation increased access to credit, the share of non-farm income, hours spent on casual work, community access to irrigation water, ownership of agricultural tools
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We use data from the Living Standard Measurement Study-Integrated Survey on Agriculture and apply the targeted maximum likelihood estimation method

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP) is Ethiopia's poverty reduction strategy
evidence_citations.country_citation: The Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP) is Ethiopia's poverty reduction strategy that forms the most important pillar of the country's agricultural transformation
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: We also observe that PSNP households have a lower level of endowments compared to non-PSNP households
